title: Public Procurement Relationship Type Vocabulary
description: Domain-specific refinement of CEP relationship types for buyers, suppliers, procedures, lots, awards, contracts, and implementation events in public procurement.

terms.label: Buyer Runs Procedure
terms.definition: A relationship where a buyer organization initiates, manages, or is responsible for a procurement procedure as the contracting authority or purchasing body.

terms.label: Contract Based on Award
terms.definition: A relationship where a contract is created based on a specific award decision for a lot or procedure, linking the legal agreement to the underlying award event.

terms.label: Contract Implemented by Supplier
terms.definition: A relationship where a supplier or group of suppliers performs the work, delivers goods, or provides services under a contract, as captured in implementation records.

terms.label: Implementation Event for Contract
terms.definition: A relationship where an implementation record, such as a payment, milestone, or amendment, is associated with a specific contract in the procurement process.

terms.label: Lot Awarded to Supplier
terms.definition: A relationship where a specific lot is awarded to one or more supplier organizations as a result of an award decision.

terms.label: Other Procurement Relationship
terms.definition: A procurement relationship type that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary but is needed to reflect source systems or standards.

terms.label: Procedure Includes Lot
terms.definition: A relationship where a procurement procedure includes one or more lots that subdivide the overall scope of goods, works, or services to be procured.

terms.label: Supplier Participates in Procedure
terms.definition: A relationship where a supplier organization expresses interest, submits a tender, or otherwise participates in a procurement procedure or lot competition.
